org.apache.ambari.server.stack.upgrade.orchestrate

Class UpgradeContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.stack.upgrade.orchestrate.UpgradeContext

  • public class UpgradeContext
extends Object
    The UpgradeContext is used to hold all information pertaining to an upgrade. It is initialized directly from an existing UpgradeEntity or from a request to create an upgrade/downgrade.

      • getStackIdFromVersions

        public StackId getStackIdFromVersions(Map<String,RepositoryVersionEntity> version)
        Getting stackId from the set of versions. Is is possible until we upgrading components on the same stack. Note: Function should be modified for cross-stack upgrade.
        Parameters:
        version - Set of services repository versions
        Returns:
        StackId based on provided versions

      • getCluster

        public Cluster getCluster()

        Returns:

      • getSourceVersions

        public Map<String,RepositoryVersionEntity> getSourceVersions()
        Gets the version that components are being considered to be "coming from".

        With a Direction.UPGRADE, this value represent the services' desired repository. However, Direction.DOWNGRADE will use the same value for all services which is the version that the downgrade is coming from.

        Returns:
        the source version for the upgrade

      • getSourceRepositoryVersion

        public RepositoryVersionEntity getSourceRepositoryVersion(String serviceName)
        Gets the version that service is being considered to be "coming from".

        With a Direction.UPGRADE, this value represent the services' desired repository. However, Direction.DOWNGRADE will use the same value for all services which is the version that the downgrade is coming from.

        Returns:
        the source repository for the upgrade

      • getSourceVersion

        public String getSourceVersion(String serviceName)
        Gets the version that service is being considered to be "coming from".

        With a Direction.UPGRADE, this value represent the services' desired repository. However, Direction.DOWNGRADE will use the same value for all services which is the version that the downgrade is coming from.

        Returns:
        the source repository for the upgrade
        See Also:
        getSourceRepositoryVersion(String)

      • getTargetVersions

        public Map<String,RepositoryVersionEntity> getTargetVersions()
        Gets the version being upgraded to or downgraded to for all services participating. This is the version that the service will be on if the upgrade or downgrade succeeds.

        With a Direction.UPGRADE, all services should be targetting the same repository version. However, Direction.DOWNGRADE will target the original repository that the service was on.

        Returns:
        the target version for the upgrade

      • getTargetRepositoryVersion

        public RepositoryVersionEntity getTargetRepositoryVersion(String serviceName)
        Gets the repository being upgraded to or downgraded to for the given service. This is the version that the service will be on if the upgrade or downgrade succeeds.

        With a Direction.UPGRADE, all services should be targeting the same repository version. However, Direction.DOWNGRADE will target the original repository that the service was on.

        Returns:
        the target repository for the upgrade

      • getTargetVersion

        public String getTargetVersion(String serviceName)
        Gets the version being upgraded to or downgraded to for the given service. This is the version that the service will be on if the upgrade or downgrade succeeds.

        With a Direction.UPGRADE, all services should be targetting the same repository version. However, Direction.DOWNGRADE will target the original repository that the service was on.

        Returns:
        the target version for the upgrade
        See Also:
        getTargetRepositoryVersion(String)

      • addUnhealthy

        public void addUnhealthy(List<ServiceComponentHost> unhealthy)
        Parameters:
        unhealthy - a list of unhealthy host components

      • getRepositoryVersion

        public RepositoryVersionEntity getRepositoryVersion()
        Gets the single repository version for the upgrade depending on the direction.

        If the direction is Direction.UPGRADE then this will return the target repository which every service will be on if the upgrade is finalized.

        If the direction is Direction.DOWNGRADE then this will return the repository from which the downgrade is coming from.

        Returns:
        the target repository version for this upgrade (never null).

      • getServiceDisplay

        public String getServiceDisplay(String service)
        Returns:
        the service display name, or the service name if not set

      • getOrchestrationType

        public org.apache.ambari.spi.RepositoryType getOrchestrationType()
        Gets the repository type to determine if this upgrade is a complete upgrade or a service/patch. This value is not always the same as the repository version. In the case of a revert of a patch, the target repository may be of type STANDARD, but orchestration must be "like a patch".
        Returns:
        the orchestration type.

      • getInitializedCommandParameters

        public Map<String,String> getInitializedCommandParameters()
        Gets a map initialized with parameters required for upgrades to work. The following properties are already set:
        • COMMAND_PARAM_CLUSTER_NAME
        • COMMAND_PARAM_DIRECTION
        • COMMAND_PARAM_UPGRADE_TYPE
        • KeyNames#REFRESH_CONFIG_TAGS_BEFORE_EXECUTION - necessary in order to have the commands contain the correct configurations. Otherwise, they will contain the configurations that were available at the time the command was created. For upgrades, this is problematic since the commands are all created ahead of time, but the upgrade may change configs as part of the upgrade pack.
          Returns:
          the initialized parameter map.

        • toString

          public String toString()
          Overrides:
          toString in class Object

        • isDowngradeAllowed

          public boolean isDowngradeAllowed()
          Gets whether a downgrade is allowed for this upgrade. If the direction is Direction.DOWNGRADE, then this method always returns false. Otherwise it will consule UpgradePack.isDowngradeAllowed().
          Returns:
          true of a downgrade is allowed for this upgrade, false otherwise.

        • isPatchRevert

          public boolean isPatchRevert()
          Returns:

        • getPatchRevertUpgradeId

          public long getPatchRevertUpgradeId()

        • getDefaultMaxDegreeOfParallelism

          public int getDefaultMaxDegreeOfParallelism()
          Returns:
          default value of number of tasks to run in parallel during upgrades

        • getUpgradeSummary

          public UpgradeSummary getUpgradeSummary()
          Gets a POJO of the upgrade suitable to serialize.
          Returns:
          the upgrade summary as a POJO.

        • getTargetStack

          public StackId getTargetStack()
          Gets the single target stack for the upgrade. By definition, ALL the targets, despite the versions, should have the same stack. The source stacks may be different from the target, but all the source stacks must also be the same.

          Returns:
          the target stack for this upgrade (never null).

        • getSourceStack

          public StackId getSourceStack()
          Gets the single source stack for the upgrade depending on the direction. By definition, ALL the source stacks, despite the versions, should have the same stack. The target stacks may be different from the source, but all the target stacks must also be the same.

          Returns:
          the source stack for this upgrade (never null).

        • getKerberosDetails

          public KerberosDetails getKerberosDetails()
                                   throws KerberosInvalidConfigurationException,
                                          org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
          Gets Kerberos information about a cluster. It should only be invoked if the cluster's security type is set to SecurityType.KERBEROS, otherwise it will throw an AmbariException.
          Returns:
          the Kerberos related details of a cluster.
          Throws:
          KerberosInvalidConfigurationException - if the kerberos-env or krb5-conf} configurations can't be parsed.
          org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if the cluster is not Kerberized.

        • getOrchestrationOptions

          public org.apache.ambari.spi.upgrade.OrchestrationOptions getOrchestrationOptions()
          Returns:
          the orchestration options, or null if not defined

        • buildUpgradeInformation

          public org.apache.ambari.spi.upgrade.UpgradeInformation buildUpgradeInformation()
          Builds a UpgradeInformation instance from a Cluster where there is an upgrade in progress.
          Returns:
          the UpgradeInformation instance comprised of simple POJOs and SPI classes.
